articles.author: James Mackenzie, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israeli airstrikes had killed two successors to Hezbollah's slain leader.
articles.title: Hezbollah targets Israeli troops on Lebanese border, sirens in Beirut

articles.author: Joseph Tanfani, Nathan Layne
articles.description: Pro-Trump officials' rise to prominence on local election boards raises the chances that they will be able to delay or sow doubt over the election, if Trump loses.
articles.title: Election officials who back Trump’s “Big Lie” stir concern in swing states

articles.author: Yimou Lee
articles.description: Most Taiwanese believe China is unlikely to invade in the coming five years but do see Beijing as a serious threat to the democratic island, a poll by Taiwan's top military think tank showed on Wednesday.
articles.title: Most Taiwanese believe China unlikely to invade in coming five years, poll shows

articles.author: Cassandra Garrison
articles.description: The mayor of Chilpancingo, the capital of Mexico's violence-plagued state of Guerrero, traveled alone to an out-of-town meeting before he was killed, Mexico's security minister said on Tuesday about a murder which has shocked the country.
articles.title: Mexican local mayor went alone to meeting before his brutal killing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea held a session of its Supreme People's Assembly this week, state media KCNA said on Wednesday, although there was no mention on whether it had officially changed its stance on unification between the Koreas.
articles.title: North Korea holds key parliamentary meeting amid heightened tension

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden is expected to hold a phone call on Wednesday with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu about any plans to strike Iran, Axios reported late on Tuesday, citing three U.S. officials.
articles.title: Biden to speak to Netanyahu about Iran retaliation on Wednesday, Axios reports

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: A television debate ahead of Moldova's presidential election broke up on Tuesday when pro-European incumbent Maia Sandu did not attend and one of her two main rivals walked out of the studio.
articles.title: Moldovan president's no-show breaks up election debate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's air defence units destroyed 47 Ukrainian drones targeting its west, the defence ministry said on Wednesday, while regional officials said the attacks caused no casualties.
articles.title: Ukraine launches tens of drones on Russia's western regions, Moscow says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hezbollah officials are no longer demanding a truce in Gaza as a condition for reaching a ceasefire in Lebanon, rowing back from an oft-repeated promise to keep fighting until Israel halts its offensive against Hezbollah's Iran-backed ally Hamas.
articles.title: Hezbollah officials drop Gaza truce as condition for Lebanon ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te is escalating tensions with "sinister intentions", China's government said, ahead of a keynote speech Lai will give in Taipei that could set off a Chinese military response.
articles.title: Taiwan president is escalating tensions, China says ahead of key speech
